HOW DO YOU PAY WITH THE APP?
Here is information for you If you are a refugee from Ukraine since 24th of February and consider studying in Denmark. On this page you can get information about:
how and if you can verify your current education
what are your options for studying in Denmark
how to check if you can receive SU while studying in Denmark
You can varify your diplom to be able to study or work in Denmark within your profession. Your assessment can be applied either online or in PDF format.
What are the the required document to be included in the application?
How do I fill in the online application?
How do I fill in the PDF application?
You can continue studying your higher education programme in Denmark or begin a new higher education in Denmark. To do this you can:
1. apply for a transfer from your Ukrainian higher education programme to a Danish higher education programme or
2. apply for admission to a new full time higher education programme in Denmark.
More information about education options and relevant links can be found here:
How do I apply for a transfer?
How do I apply for admission?
How do I apply for SU or SU-loan?
“SU” and “SU-loan” is State Educational Grant and Loan Scheme. Society lends students a helping hand in covering living costs for a great variety of courses and studies.

If you want to apply for SU or a SU-loan, you must apply for SU in minSU. Log on to minSU from a computer insted af a mobile device - they do not recieve all applications completed via a mobile device. For this you need to log in with your MitID. If you are not sure how to use MitID, check out the page within the Essentials category, or click this button:
If you are a refugee from Ukraine, you may apply for equal status with Danish citizens, if you fall within Section 2(2) of the Act on Integration of Aliens in Denmark:
How do I apply for SU as a Ukrainian refugee?
What are the the required document to be included in the application?

1. Diploma/certificate in the original language for each qualification that you want to have assessed. If you have more than one higher education qualification (e.g. a bachelor’s degree and a master’s degree), please enclose all of the documents.

" 2. Transcript in the original language for each qualification that you want to have assessed. If you are unable to provide the transcript, please list in your own words the subjects studied and passed."

" 3. Translation of the diploma/certificate for each qualification that you want to have assessed, unless it is in Norwegian, Swedish, English, German, French, or Spanish. If you attach a Diploma Supplement issued in one of the languages mentioned, translation is not necessary (see point 5)."

" 4. Translation of transcript for each qualification that you want to have assessed, unless it is in Norwegian, Swedish, English, German, French, or Spanish. If you attach a Diploma Supplement issued in one of the languages mentioned, translation is not necessary (see point 5)."
" 5. If you have a Diploma Supplement, please enclose it. The Diploma Supplement is issued by the higher education institutions in the EU/EEA countries."
" 6. If you want assessment of a degree, please enclose the entrance qualification, e.g. high school certificate."
" 7. If the name on any of the documents is different from the name you are currently using: Name change documentation, e.g. marriage certificate."
" 8. If your qualifications have been assessed before: Former assessment(s) or recognition decision(s)."
" The Danish Agency for Higher Education and Science may ask you for further documentation of your qualifications, including original documents. "
How do I fill in the online application?
" 1. You as an applicant: Name, address etc. Most of the fields are filled in automatically."

" 2. The purpose of your application. You will also be asked if you want the assessment in Danish or English. You can only get the assessment in one language. We recommend Danish if you are going to apply for jobs or education in Denmark."
" 3. Education: Please give information about each of the education programmes that you have completed, except short programmes/courses."
" 5. Sending the application. Here you can check all of your information."
" When you have sent the application, you will get a receipt."
How do I fill in the PDF application?
" 1. Fill in the application form. Fields marked * are required. "
" 3. Enclose all of the required documentation."
" 4. Send the application, or hand it in at Haraldsgade 53, Copenhagen Ø."
" Send to: Danish Agency for Higher Education and Science, Haraldsgade 53, DK-2100 Copenhagen Ø."
" If you have a Danish CPR number and NemID/MitID you can send your application by Digital Post, unless you are to submit original documents."
How to apply for a transfer

To apply for a transfer, it is required that you fulfil the general and specific admission requirements of the particular Danish higher education programme, and that there are available study places at the higher education programme.

" The higher education institutions in Denmark set their own procedures for applications for transfers, so you need to contact them directly in order to know more about the possibilities for a transfer. The individual higher education institution will also be able to guide you regarding ongoing higher education programmes at the institution."
How do I apply for admission?
If you haven’t passed the equivalent of the first year of a Danish higher education programme, you can apply for admission to the higher education programme in quota

" You can apply on https://www.optagelse.dk. Application deadlines are 15th of March every year. The higher education institutions have the option of giving a dispensation from application deadlines given unusual circumstances."

" In the 2022 admission round there are 12 English taught higher education programmes on an academy profession level or professional bachelor level, where Ukrainian applicants with an Ukrainian upper secondary diploma do not have to pass a test in order to be admitted."

" If you want to apply for a bachelor’s programme and you have a Ukrainian upper secondary diploma, you must have passed at least one year of studies at a higher education programme besides your Ukrainian upper secondary education."
How do I apply for SU as a Ukrainian refugee?
If you are a refugee from Ukraine, you may apply for equal status with Danish citizens, if you fall within Section 2(2) of the Act on Integration of Aliens in Denmark

" Please be aware that if you want to apply for equal status with Danish citizens because you fall within Section 2(4) (other aliens granted family reunification) of the Act on Integration of Aliens in Denmark, you must have obtained the right to reside in Denmark according to this rule on 1 July 2019 or later."

Welcome to “Youkraine!” The Danish system can be hard to navigate. It is very digitalised, which might be new and challenging to some people. Therefore, we provide you with a good overview of essential applications and processes such as MitID, E-Boks, benefits and more. As well as, stuff you will encounter on an everyday basis. This includes the likes of the transportation system, health system and more........
